I'm OK with this change, but as discussed offline, we now assign LEDs on a per-fan-drawer basis, so having the LED color in each fan row here could be a bit confusing to the user. One option would be to separate the output by fan drawer similar to the following:

```
Drawer Name: drawer1   
        LED: green
 Fan status:

   Fan Name     Speed    Direction     Presence    Status          Timestamp
-----------  --------  -----------  -----------  --------  -----------------
       fan1       92%       intake      Present        OK  20200414 09:39:52
       fan2       81%       intake      Present        OK  20200414 09:39:52
```

Thoughts?

> I'm OK with this change, but as discussed offline, we now assign LEDs on a per-fan-drawer basis, so having the LED color in each fan row here could be a bit confusing to the user. One option would be to separate the output by fan drawer similar to the following:
> 
> ```
> Drawer Name: drawer1   
>         LED: green
>  Fan status:
> 
>    Fan Name     Speed    Direction     Presence    Status          Timestamp
> -----------  --------  -----------  -----------  --------  -----------------
>        fan1       92%       intake      Present        OK  20200414 09:39:52
>        fan2       81%       intake      Present        OK  20200414 09:39:52
> ```
> 
> Thoughts?

This would be clearer for Mellanox platform. But I am not sure if it is OK for those platform which has no fan drawer. I prefer to keep current implementation.

Thanks for this addition. Just curious if, rather than adding a new `show ntpstat` command, we should intead simply add this output to the existing `show ntp` command, something like the following (IP addresses don't align, as I copied and pasted from two different examples):

```
user@sonic:~$ show ntp
synchronised to NTP server (192.168.16.4) at stratum 7 
   time correct to within 326797 ms
   polling server every 64 s

     remote           refid      st t when poll reach   delay   offset  jitter
==============================================================================
 23.92.29.245    .XFAC.          16 u    - 1024    0    0.000    0.000   0.000
*204.2.134.164   46.233.231.73    2 u  916 1024  377    3.079    0.394   0.128
```

> Thanks for this addition. Just curious if, rather than adding a new `show ntpstat` command, we should intead simply add this output to the existing `show ntp` command, something like the following (IP addresses don't align, as I copied and pasted from two different examples):
> 
> ```
> user@sonic:~$ show ntp
> synchronised to NTP server (192.168.16.4) at stratum 7 
>    time correct to within 326797 ms
>    polling server every 64 s
> 
>      remote           refid      st t when poll reach   delay   offset  jitter
> ==============================================================================
>  23.92.29.245    .XFAC.          16 u    - 1024    0    0.000    0.000   0.000
> *204.2.134.164   46.233.231.73    2 u  916 1024  377    3.079    0.394   0.128
> ```

Good advice, Thanks. I will enhance it as your proposal.
